title: Foxe chief executive calls time on 15 - year reign
body_text:
Foxes’ chief executive calls time on 15-year reign
Leicester City Football Club has announced that Susan Whelan will step down as chief executive officer after 15 years at the helm.
Whelan joined the Club’s Board following King Power’s acquisition in 2010 and became CEO a year later.
In the interim, Chairman Aiyawatt Srivaddhanaprabha will serve as acting CEO, while senior representatives meet with the Fan Advisory Board to ensure continued fan engagement.
Over her tenure, she played a pivotal role in some of the Club’s most historic moments, including the rise from the...
